name: Tarek Hamid
title: PhD Student
bio: Working on spectroscopy-based wearable biosensors for non-invasive health monitoring.
fullBio: Tarek Hamid is a PhD Student in Computer Engineering at the University of Virginia. His research interests include Wearable Technology, Digital Health, Medical Cyber-Physical Systems, and Machine Learning. He has previously held roles at companies such as Johnson & Johnson, the Department of Defense, JPMorgan Chase, and Sotera Digital Health. He currently holds an MS in biomedical engineering from Johns Hopkins University and a BS in biomedical engineering from the College of New Jersey.

name: Elizabeth C. Courtney
title: Undergraduate Student
bio: My research interests include Wearable Technology, Internet of Medical Things, and High Performance Athletics.
fullBio: Elizabeth Courtney is an undergraduate student pursuing her Bachelors in Electrical Engineering at the University of Virginia. Her research interests include medical devices, wearable technology, machine learning, and embedded systems.

name: Patricia D. Flores
title: Undergraduate Student
bio: My research interests include Wearable Technology and High Performance Athletics.
fullBio: Patricia Flores is an undergraduate student pursuing a Bachelors in Electrical Engineering at the University of Virginia. She is currently working as an undergraduate research assistant in the Watson Research Lab, which develops wearable technology for healthcare and athletic performance.

name: Haoran Zhang
title: PhD Student
bio: My research interests include wearable technology, medical devices, high performance athletics, cyber-physical systems, and machine learning.
fullBio: Haoran Zhang is a PhD Student in Computer Engineering at the University of Virginia. His research interests include Wearable Technology, Digital Health, Medical Cyber-Physical Systems, and Machine Learning. He currently holds an MS in Computer Science from Duke University and a BS in Information Systems from the George Washington University.

name: Sharon Lu
title: Firmware Engineer at Xbox | Undergraduate Alumni
bio: My research interests include wearable technology, medical devices, high performance athletics, cyber-physical systems, and machine learning.
fullBio: Sharon Lu is an undergraduate student majoring in Computer Engineering and minoring in Engineering Business. Her research interests include wearable technology, medical devices, high performance athletics, cyber-physical systems, and machine learning.

education.degree: BS in Computer Engineering, Minor in Engineering Business

name: Kidus Fasil
title: Signal Processing Engineer at Spectric Labs | Undergraduate & Masters Alumni
bio: My research interests include Wearable Technology, Internet of Things, and Embedded Systems
fullBio: Kidus Fasil is an Graduate Student pursuing his Masters in Computer Engineering at the University of Virginia. His research interests include Wearable Technology, Internet of Things, and Embedded Systsems. He is a member of the Watson Research Lab, which develops wearable technology for healthcare and athletic performance.

name: Tanishk Govil
title: Undergraduate Student
bio: My research interests include autonomous robots and high performance athletics.
fullBio: Tanishk Govil is an Undergraduate Student pursuing his Bachelors in Computer Science at the University of Virginia. His research interests include Smart Health, Autonomous Robotics, High Performance Athletics, and Machine Learning.

name: Amanda Watson
title: Assistant Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering
bio: My research interests include Wearable Technology, Internet of Medical Things, and High Performance Athletics.
fullBio: Amanda Watson is an Assistant Professor of Electrical and Computer Engineering at the University of Virginia. Her research interests include Wearable Technology, Internet of Medical Things, and High Performance Athletics. She leads the Watson Research Lab, which develops wearable technology for healthcare and athletic performance. She is cofounder and CEO of Luminosity Wearables a company commercializing a noninvasive continuous glucose monitor.

education.degree: BS in Computer Science and Mathematics
